title: RetentionPolicy
description: A data lifecycle management policy that governs how long data is retained and what action is taken when the retention period expires. Applicable across paradigms: time-series downsampling, key-value TTL, search index lifecycle, relational partition pruning, and archival strategies.

targetCollection.description: The collection or namespace this policy applies to.

retentionDuration.description: How long data is retained, expressed as an ISO 8601 duration (e.g., 'P30D' for 30 days, 'P1Y' for 1 year, 'P6M' for 6 months).

action.description: Action taken when data exceeds the retention period. DELETE: permanently remove. ARCHIVE: move to cold storage. DOWNSAMPLE: aggregate and reduce resolution (time-series). MOVE_TIER: transition to a different storage tier. COMPRESS: apply compression to reduce storage footprint.

downsampleInterval.description: For DOWNSAMPLE action, the aggregation interval (e.g., '1h', '1d'). Only applicable when action is DOWNSAMPLE.
